snippet.title: Isolated in pain, yet Greatful
snippet.description: ... ... I am on a regiment of anti-depressants and pain meds. The antidepressants definately help me from becoming too despondent and hopeless. In fact, just before giving up my career a little over a year ago, I was near suicidal. I am now much more stable and am able to "see the light at the end of the tunnel" on my good days. ... ... So where does that leave me? I have been through over a year of PT and ritualistically perform my stretches throughout the day. I see a chiropractor every month. I have been on long term disability for a year now, after giving up a job I absolutely loved. ... ... Every three months I go in for cervical injections,... ...

snippet.title: tightness around the roof of my mouth and back of throat. Have you heard of this?
snippet.description: ... I fight daily migraines with verapimil. Get sensitive to noise and light with oncoming mig. Oddly, I also get a tightness on roof of mouth and upper back of throat. Heard of this? ...

snippet.title: herpes on roof of my mouth very worried
snippet.description: ... i keep getting infections on roof of my mouth my doc suggested herpes then referd me to oral sugeon there never there wen i c him they cum up as swollen lumps then seem to burst and go yellow then dissapear .my doc gave me acyclovir it helps iv been to oral surgeon today as i have outbreak again he wernt there so they are going to take a picture tommorow im very worried i have had blood tests hiv tests cos im so worried .no one i no has herpes on roof of mouth only on lips why am i getting this it started last yr and iv had about 7 outbreaks its relly getting me down my docs not sure if it is herpes ...

snippet.title: horrible pain of the roof of my mouth! pls help
My 85-year old father fell from his roof while cleaning out his gutters.
snippet.description: ... My 85-year old father fell from his roof while cleaning out his gutters. The surgery for his hip fracture went well but the surgeon says he's not out of the woods yet. We're not sure what that means exactly. Can you enlighten us? Hip fractures in older adults can be complex and challenging to treat and manage well. Fractures from a high-energy injury such as your father's fall from a height can be accompanied by other injuries as well. Sometimes it takes some time for other problems to surface. Any hip fracture can be the catalyst that causes loss of independence. Serious complications such as pneumonia, infection, and blood clots can compromise return to health. Your father will be under close surveillance while in the hospital until his condition is stable. Most older adults have some form of osteoporosis. The bone loses mass and density and becomes more prone to fracture. This makes it difficult to stabilize the fracture with plates, screws, or pins inserted into or even through the b... ...
